segments.text: I see the woman standing by the sink, completely unaware of the water overflowing around her.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: It’s like she’s in her own little world, not noticing the chaos around her, and I find it quite surprising.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The kids are being so sneaky, trying to get cookies from the jar without her knowing, and it’s quite surprising how determined they are.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I notice the boy is standing on a stool that looks like it’s about to tip over, but he’s determined to get those cookies, and it’s surprising how balanced he is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The girl is just standing there, waiting for her share, like it’s the most natural thing in the world, and it’s surprising how patient she is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The whole scene is just so chaotic, but everyone seems so calm and collected, and it’s quite surprising.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I see the water pouring over the edge of the sink, spreading across the floor, and I’m surprised by how much water is coming out of the sink.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The boy is stretching so far, and it looks really dangerous, but he seems to know what he’s doing, and it’s surprising how determined he is.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I hope he doesn’t fall, but I’m surprised by how calm everyone is, like they don’t even care about the chaos around them.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: The garden outside looks so calm and tidy, contrasting with the surprising chaos inside the kitchen.
segments.speaker: PAR

segments.text: I think the woman needs to turn around and see what’s happening behind her, but for now, she’s completely absorbed in her task, and it’s surprising how unaware she is.
segments.speaker: PAR
